hobby.message: Get any ribbon for that antique typewriter yet?
Freestyle FPV... your kind of silence, right?
You still hunting political literature no one’s supposed to find?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me. In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Fine. Quiet night, no trouble.
Did a bit of flying earlier, just out by the old warehouses.
My drone stayed up longer than usual. Lucky, I guess.
That’s all, really.
Not bad, thanks. Escaped work after system traffic died down.
I fly drones, usually over the industrial edge. Keeps me sharp.
Lots more patrols since those news leaks. Makes it tricky.
Had to re-route mid-flight after a shutdown alert.
It’s getting tough to find clear airspace.
Pretty good, honestly. Went flying earlier—FPV drones near the floodplain.
Helps me reset after maintenance shifts, just get away from screens.
Lately, security’s tighter since the ghost stuff started leaking.
Had to switch to analog feed—BCI’s mislabeling pilots now.
Saw a couple others out, but nobody talks much.
Still worth the risk. Nothing else really compares.
Hey. Better today. Got a real flight session in, northeast sector, old plant.
I do freestyle FPV—build my own quads, race sometimes, practice tricks.
Used to be low-key, but those ‘ghost’ leaks ramped up security everywhere.
Last session, some wiped guy wandered into my airspace. No band, moving strange.
We had to switch to analog to stay off the city mesh.
Felt almost outside the system, at least til the patrols came back.
Flying keeps me steady. It’s the only time I actually feel clear.
Honestly, one of the best days I’ve had in weeks.
I’m Daria. I fly custom drones—FPV, freestyle, off-grid zones mostly.
Started after my brother vanished in a BCI audit—needed distraction, maybe some way to keep watch.
After the ghost leaks, patrols have more gaps. Feels weird—system not syncing.
I met another old flyer, someone I thought disappeared.
We were all running analog, avoiding government pings, just for that little freedom.
For a couple hours, we acted like the BCI didn’t exist.
Flying’s my reset. Only place I don’t feel watched or judged, at least for now.
hobby_answer: Yeah. Still flying. Nothing much changes.
Industrial zones only, quick flights, quiet exits.
More patrols lately since the leak. Not ideal.
Airspace is unpredictable now. Just stick to routine.
Mostly keep my head down, fly solo.
Mostly. I avoid the main towers, keep it low profile.
Patrols have doubled since the council leaks. Ruins the mood.
Saw some odd faces near the yards—not officials.
Signal blackout caught me last week—glitch or something else.
Feels like everyone’s watching, even the machines.
I don’t linger long out there.
Yeah, still dodging towers.
Was out by the floodplain last weekend, drones everywhere now.
The ghost leaks messed up patrol routines.
Had to switch to analog video, system lagged bad.
Someone unregistered walked right onto the field.
Security didn’t catch it, too busy with BCI glitches.
Moment of real freedom, felt strange but good.
Yeah, still out there—barely.
The leaks made flying weird. Patrols glitch, BCI misses things.
Last flight, blackout hit mid-session. Signals scrambled, overlays froze.
Saw a guy—definitely ghost, no band, too careful.
We used analog to dodge official feeds. Kind of risky.
Almost felt like old days for a while.
Quieter pilots swap info in person now.
Every outing since the council talks feels like bending the rules.
Definitely. Flying’s the only time things make sense.
Ever since the ghost deal, security can’t keep up. BCI’s lost track of people.
Last session, half the grid went offline. We got peak access, pure luck.
A ghost showed up—walked straight through the field. Nobody flagged it.
System’s confused, old overlays pick up ghost tags. Weird to see.
We bounce analog now, share footage offline. Digital’s too risky.
Used to fly to escape, now it’s to test the rules.
My brother’s face flashed on a legacy tag—I skidded out.
Maybe system breaking down isn’t all bad. For a few hours, it felt real.
